intro: Howardia caudata, commonly known as the curly hair plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Mesembryanthemaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a unique, almost fluffy appearance. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically during the spring and summer months. Howardia caudata is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
